availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Michael Enright (Jefferson County, KY, retail grocer & flour dealer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, retail grocer and wholesale flour dealer. Native of Ireland. Married to Johanna Leahy Enright. Father of Daniel J. Enright and Cornelius J. Enright. Retail grocer in Louisville in 1859. Signed a petition as a flour dealer in May 1861 to appoint W. G. Timberlake as flour inspector.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 81A-B.
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1859-60 (Louisville: Maxwell & Co., 1859), 75, 280.
Find A Grave, "Michael Enright (1824-1898)," Memorial #129859049, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/129859049 (accessed January 23, 2020).
